intro: Lychnis alpina f. albiflora, commonly known as the alpine white-flowered catchfly, is a flowering plant native to alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the carnation family, Caryophyllaceae, and is characterized by its low-growing habit and clustered flowers. The variety albiflora is distinguished by its white petals, contrasting with the typical pink or red hues of the species. Its small, showy flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. This plant thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous habitats.
